meanings.definition: Tawdry: showy but cheap and of poor quality
meanings.sent1: The tawdrier necklace broke easily because it was poorly made.
meanings.sent2: She wore a tawdrier dress to the party, standing out for all the wrong reasons.
meanings.sent3: The tawdrier decorations at the event made everyone chuckle at their tackiness.
meanings.sent4: The tawdrier furniture in the room screamed of low quality and lack of taste.
meanings.sent5: The tawdrier shoes fell apart after just a few wears, proving their cheapness.

meanings.definition: Tawdry: gaudy or tasteless in appearance
meanings.sent1: The tawdrier painting clashed with the rest of the room's decor.
meanings.sent2: Her tawdrier accessories drew attention for all the wrong reasons.
meanings.sent3: The tawdrier outfit she wore to the event made her friends giggle at its loudness.
meanings.sent4: The tawdrier colors of the house exterior made it stand out in an unflattering way.
meanings.sent5: The tawdrier design of the car made it look like a child's toy rather than a luxury vehicle.

meanings.definition: Tawdry: to make something appear gaudy or cheap
meanings.sent1: She tawdriered the room by adding too many bright and clashing decorations.
meanings.sent2: He tawdriers his outfits by wearing mismatched patterns and colors.
meanings.sent3: The decorator tawdriered the space with over-the-top and cheap-looking furniture.
meanings.sent4: The marketing team tawdriered the product packaging, making it look like a dollar store item.
meanings.sent5: The artist tawdriered the painting by using garish colors and excessive glitter, ruining its elegance.
